item.title: Leaf tipping!, 22nd December
item.description:
The leaves need to be collected (they were too heavy to transport anywhere else) Of note, Point Hill isn’t in your leaf clearing schedules. It’s a very steep street, one of the steepest in Greenwich and wet leaves are hazardous. Please can you review next year

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Point Hill, Greenwich

item.title: Tree lifting pavement, 22nd December

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amberley Road, Edmonton, Greater London

item.title: Roadside thick with sludgy leaves. Very slippery and muddy. On restricted parking road so needs cleaning between 1-2pm Mon Friday gor best access., 22nd December
item.description:
High number of trees in this area. Has not been cleared this autumn. Heavy rain has made hazardous. Elderly high risk of falls. Issue since September onwards. Increasing over season.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Camden, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: England flags remain on lampposts for over 6 months, 22nd December
item.description:
Along the entirety of Wellington Road there still remains England flags that were attached to every lamppost. These have been there since the beginning of summer and the council have only taken action to remove them from some of the busier main roads around Orpington. I hope you can understand that these flags are connected with concerns of racism and not everyone along this road agrees with it, yet as a resident I have to see it from my own window every day for many months. At times I feel embarrassed having visitors and I can imagine it impacts the attractiveness of people trying to sell their houses here. Despite trying to contact the council multiple times this request seems to continue being ignored. The flags are too high to remove ourselves and need support from the council to be taken down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Wellington Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving jutting out (tree and tubing possibly pushing paving out), 22nd December
item.description:
20/12/25 6:45pm I tried parking at kerbside in the dark and didn't see the paving was jutting out and my tyre burst. It isn't obvious in the dark or when the leaves are on the ground but it's a trip/accident/hazard. I noticed there is not only a tree but also a pipe there which could be the reason for the paving being obtrusive

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carlton Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 22nd December

Thank you Reference - 5201853 Map link - open Google map Report history - Status: Received 22/12/2025 15:34 Please remove these graffiti. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Station Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
